instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the model performance in the wood species identificationand how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the model performance in the wood species identification was accuracy. The accuracy metric measures the percentage of correctly identified wood species by the model. The support-vector-machine-based wood-species identification model achieved an accuracy of 98.24%.

The accuracy metric provides a measure of how well the model performs in correctly identifying the wood species. However, it does not provide information about the model's performance on individual classes or potential biases in the predictions. Therefore, while accuracy is a useful metric, it may not provide a complete understanding of the model's performance in all scenarios.
